I want to keep it low ECL, so i post ECLs i wanna to choose from - availeble gifts: drow subrace (adds +2 char +2 int 32 SR for 2ECL), mark of humilty (-2ECL, but - 2 to all abilities)

Cheers.

posts.author: MrZork
posts.content:
Just curious because I am not very familiar with the Arelith system: Why bother with both the drow subrace and the humility gifts? Is it just for role-play purposes? Humility nerfs all of the advantages of the drow subrace except for 32 SR and darkness 1/day, which seems like a poor trade for no net gain in INT, CHA, or DEX, and -2 STR, -2 WIS, and -4 CON. Meanwhile, the evil-only alignment restrictions preclude taking paladin for the saving throw bonuses and possible divine shield.

Obviously, if you mean that you might create a drow sorcerer without the humility "gift" (or even the drow subrace gift), then that may work out fine. Having +2 CHA and INT could be a nice edge for this build (especially as sorcerers are often skill starved). I would definitely not take humility. If level advancement with +2 ECL will be too slow, then drop the drow subrace gift, but that would depend on how quickly you need the toon to advance.

posts.content: You would still have -2 on your STR, DEX, CON, and WIS. That's huge. You are better off with the ECL from Drow, or taking no gift at all.

posts.author: HipMaestro
posts.content:
I agree with the the others that the gift appears to be more a curse than a gift and would decline it unless there is some RP reason to penalize your toon.

The most obvious multiclass for synergy would be to go LG with 4 levels of pally... nothing innovative naturally, but you'll get great saves, an AC bonus from Div Shield that will stack with EMA and if you decide to melee using a polymorph (eg. tenser's or FE golem), you can select Div Might (along w/DS), castable while polymorphed.  

With high CHA, the benefits will be significant and still will be able to avoid dispels other than Mords with 26 levels of sorc (even a pure Sorc 30 can be dispelled by Mords anyway).  Pretty much run-of-the-mill exploit for a CHA build. Actually, you could even add 3 levels of a tertiary dump class (perhaps one idea might be to grab monk progression for use with polymorphs using creature weapons and a late tumble dump plus some handy "monkish" feats) since Sorc 23 should still be able to grab a few epic spells (though I haven't actually sketched it out myself yet).
